HOCK--Morton, June 24, 1929 - April 25, 2015, after a long and brave struggle with leukemia. Mort's devotion to Anita (Zagerman), his loving wife of 55 years, to his children Jennifer Brod and Jonathan, their spouses Bruce and Lynn, and his grandchildren Eric, Madison, Eddie and Joseph, was the stuff of legend. Mort had a celebrated 50-year career in the motion picture industry. He was President of the Variety Club charity, a member of the Friar's Club, and a member of the Motion Picture Academy. Services Tuesday 11:45am at "The Riverside," 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave. 1/3

SPARBERG--Esther Braun, 92. Beloved mother of Alice (Nick) Alexiou and Andrew (Donna) Sparberg. Grandmother of Mark (Rebecca), Neil, Alex (Ayse) and Joseph. Great-grandmother of Jacob and Brooke. Wife of the late Lester Sparberg. She was the only female recipient of a B.S. in chemistry at the University of North Carolina in 1943. She taught chemistry at Hofstra University for 40 years. She travelled everywhere, read voraciously, and had many dear friends. She was a firm believer in hybrid vigor. We will miss her. Donations to: Center for Science in the Public Interest, or to Metropolitan Jewish Hospice. 1/3

Ruth was blessed with nine great-grandchildren, Brenden, Ryan, Kayla, Myles, Joely, Brooke, Juliette, Brielle, and Gavin. Ruth's funeral and interment will take place on Monday, April 27, 2015 at noon at Menorah Gardens, Southwest Ranches, FL. In lieu of flowers, please make any donations in Ruth's memory to the Bernard Rothfeld Childrens' Foundation, P.O. Box. 213399, Royal Palm Beach, FL 33421. 1/3

MILLER--Harvey R. The Columbia Law School community mourns the death of Harvey R. Miller, a lecturer and distinguished graduate from the Class of 1959 who was one of the premier bankruptcy attorneys in the United States. Harvey, who attended Columbia Law School on the G.I. Bill, taught a popular course on bankruptcy here, which some students affectionately called "Miller Time." A loyal and devoted alumnus, Harvey served on both the Board of Visitors and the Dean's Council. In 2008, he established the Harvey R. Miller Professorship, currently held by Dean Emeritus David Schizer. In 2003, Harvey and his wife created the Harvey R. and Ruth Miller Scholarship, an endowed fund that supports Columbia Law School students who have graduated from public institutions, including his alma mater, CUNY. Harvey was a longtime partner at Weil, Gotshal & Manges, which has established in his honor the Harvey R. Miller Lecture Series at Columbia Law School. Our hearts go out to Harvey's wife, Ruth, and to Harvey's friends and family. 1/3

May, Chairman of the Boards of Trustees; Steven Hochberg, Senior Vice Chairman of the Boards of Trustees; Kenneth L. Davis, MD, President and CEO; Dennis S. Charney, MD, Anne and Joel Ehrenkranz Dean, Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai and President for Academic Affairs, Mount Sinai Health System 1/3

KARDON--Annette Rappaport, of Scarsdale, NY, on April 26, 2015, peacefully at age 96. Beloved wife of the late Leonard Kardon. Devoted mother to Stephen (predeceased), Nancy, Peter, and James, and a special motherin-law to Nataline, Ellen, David, Joe, Dee Ella, and Nancy. Adoring grandmother of many, and great-grandmother of 10. From her parents, who wandered long before immigrating to the US, she learned to love world travel. Her children learned from her a love of theater. A Hunter College graduate who earned an MA from Columbia with a thesis on existentialist novels, she taught English for 18 years at Dodge Vocational High School in the Bronx. A past president of Scarsdale Women's ORT, she was a long-time member of Temple Israel of White Plains. Services will be held at 10am on Tuesday, April 28, at Riverside Memorial Chapel, 21 W. Broad St., Mt. Vernon, NY. Donations may be made to Women's ORT. 1/3
O'KELLY--Aideen. Actress and Mother, on April 22, 2015. Please see online notices for more details. 1/3

CRONKITE--Peter Reilly Rush, 22, died Sunday, April 26, 2015 in Waterville, ME. He took his own life. Peter was to have graduated from Colby College, as a Classics major, in May. Peter was graduated from St. Bernard's School in Manhattan and Horace Mann School in the Bronx. Peter was Sports Editor of the Colby Echo and co-captain of the Colby rugby team. His life on teams in school and area hockey leagues as a goalie was a great happiness in his life. As a Classics major he spent one summer course studying in Greece and another on an ancheological dig in Ostia, Italy. He was slated to receive the Foster Prize for excellence in his major. Last summer he worked for his beloved Mets team at Citi Field. He also worked during the 2012 Olympics for Sports Illustrated. Peter enjoyed tutoring at the Colby Writing Center for the past two years and coached youth hockey. Peter, an avid film enthusiast, was the voice of Dennis the Menace for an animated movie when he was nine years old. He will be missed by his many Martha's Vineyard friends. Peter is survived by his parents, Deborah Rush and Chip Cronkite, and his brother Walter Cronkite lV. The funeral service will be held Saturday, May 2, 10am, at St. Thomas More Church in Manhattan. 1/3

DAUMAN--Debra, of Chappaqua, died April 26, 2015 surrounded by family and friends. Debra's depth of character, generous heart, and brilliant mind made her truly remarkable. She was a master of words and insight which allowed her not only to entertain others with her storytelling and sharp wit, but also to be a treasured source of support, guidance, and advice for her friends, loved ones, and the causes she held dear. Underlying Debra's beautiful, classy, and impeccably put together exterior lay a fiercely loyal, passionate soul who embodied integrity, bravery, and dynamic strength. She is survived by the two cherished men of her life -- husband Stewart and son Jared -- around whom her world revolved and within whom she will live on. Services will be held on April 29, 2015 at 11:15am at "The Riverside" located at 180 W 76th Street. 1/3

AMDUR--Marilyn, 86, passed away on April 25, surrounded by family. Devoted wife of the late Harry Amdur. Beloved mother of Richard and Susan, mother-in-law of Melissa and Ian, grand-mother of Olive, sister of Robert and Stanley Schindler. Born in Brooklyn; long-time volunteer at WNET-Channel 13; avid theater-goer, museum-goer, music lover, crossword puzzler. In lieu of flowers, please consider a donation to Villa Marie Claire hospice, Saddle River, NJ. Funeral at Schoem's Menorah Chapel, Paramus, April 28, 11:30am.
HOCK--Mort. We're deeply saddened by the loss of our very dear friend Mort. A man of keen insight, intelligence and quick wit. He pitched a FastBall to the end! Bonnie & Bob Cooperman 1/3

LEVINE--Barbara. Loving mother of Ron Levine and Judy and Alan Garet. Adoring grandmother of Jackie, Lindsay and Connor Garet, Joseph and Matthew Levine. Beloved sister of Rabbi Richard Steinbrink. Her strength and family devotion have been an inspiration to all who have known her. Funeral is Tuesday at 12 noon at Gutterman's Funeral Home, Rockville Centre, NY. 1/3

MILLER--Harvey. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Harvey Miller, beloved husband of Ruth, to whom he was married for 60 years. Harvey leaves behind a loving family that carries on a tradition of exceptional philanthropy. We extend our heartfelt condolences to the entire family. Alisa R. Doctoroff, President; Linda Mirels, Chair of the Board; Eric S. Goldstein, CEO 1/3

GOTBAUM--Victor H. A public Memorial Service will be held on Monday, May 4, 2015 at 11am at the Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust, 36 Battery Place, New York. Remembrances may be made to VNSNY Hospice, 1250 Broadway, 7th Floor, New York, NY 10001 www.vnsny.org/donate; or The Museum of Jewish Heritage, 36 Battery Place, New York, NY 10280 www.mjhnyc.org. 1/3

AUERBACH--Gloria. The Harmonie Club notes with sorrow the passing of our honored member Mrs. Gloria Auerbach. We extend our heartfelt condolences to her entire family. Philip R. Cowen President The Harmonie Club 1/3

ABELSON--David, 93. Beloved husband of Rita (nee Kotcher). Loving father of Alan Abelson, Leslie and Steven Willinger, Eileen and Daniel Friedman, Andra Welch, Sheryl and Lloyd Miller and dear grandfather of Jessica, Briana and Brian. He was a World War II Veteran in the 82nd Airborne. He actively participated in North Africa, Italy, on D-Day he landed in a glider behind enemy lines to help liberate Ste Mere Eglise and then the Battle of the Bulge. He will be remembered as a fine and kind man. funeral services graveside at Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, NY, 11:30am Tuesday April 28th. Shiva will be observed at home Tuesday - Thursday from 2-5 and 7-9pm. 1/3

MILLER--Harvey R. The Metropolitan Opera mourns the death of Harvey Miller, a devoted friend of the company for many years. Harvey joined the Met board in 2005 and has served as an Advisory Director since 2007. He provided us with sage advice, while also supporting the Met with his regular attendance at performances, his participation in many Met gala evenings, and his generous gifts. Harvey helped the Met significantly during our 125th Anniversary Fundraising drive, and he named a clarinet chair in the Met Orchestra. On behalf of the entire Met company, we extend our sincere condolences to his wife, Ruth, and to his family and friends. Ann Ziff, Chairman of the Board Kevin W. Kennedy, President & CEO Peter Gelb, General Manager 1/3

CASSEL--Daniel. The Board of Governors and members of Rockrimmon Country Club are profoundly saddened by the passing of their beloved friend and esteemed former member. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to all members of the Cassel Family. Robert J. Bluestone, President 1/3
